node.title: Patrick Mahomes opens up about "being the villain" in NFL games
node.description: Patrick Mahomes will sit down with CBS News' Nate Burleson on Monday to talk about everything from football to fatherhood.
node.content: ["Patrick Mahomes, the reigning Super Bowl MVP and the quarterback of the Kansas City Chiefs, spoke with CBS News' Nate Burleson about everything from football to fatherhood for an interview airing Monday on CBS Mornings.", "In an exclusive clip previewing their conversation, Mahomes said he loves \"being the villain\" when playing against NFL opponents.\u00a0", "While it's \"cool\" to be the hero at Arrowhead Stadium, the Chiefs' home field, it's \"just as fun\" to defeat division opponents on the road, Mahomes said.\u00a0", "\"Both are great. But even though I hide the smile, I like being the villain sometimes,\" Mahomes said.\u00a0", "The two-time Super Bowl champion has also been named the Most Valuable Player twice. In addition to his superstar status on the field, Mahomes, 27, is also a father of two. He and his wife Brittany Mahomes share daughter Sterling Skye Mahomes and son Patrick \"Bronze\" Lavon Mahomes III.\u00a0", "A Netflix docuseries focusing on NFL quarterbacks also premiered this week. Mahomes is featured in the documentary as one of several quarterbacks sharing his journeys on and off the field.\u00a0", "Kerry Breen is a news editor and reporter for CBS News. Her reporting focuses on current events, breaking news and substance use."]
